                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Calculate the difference between the two prices.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $ \begin{array}{cccc} & 3 & 4 & 5 & 6 & 7 & 3 & 0 & 0 \ {}- & 2 & 3 & 9 & 9 & 7 & 3 & 2 & 4 \ \hline & 1 & 0 & 5 & 6 & 9 & 9 & 7 & 6 \ \end{array} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $10569976$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Polly‚Äôs bill in a shop came to $\pounds 374.67$.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Ellie‚Äôs bill came to $\pounds 263.21$.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                What was the total they spent altogether?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                $ \begin{array}{cccc} & 3 & 7 & 4 . & 6 & 7 \ {}+ & 2 & 6 & 3 . & 2 & 1 \ \hline & 6 & 3 & 7 . & 8 & 8 \ \end{array} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    An iPhone used to cost $\pounds 500$. Since Brexit the price has increased by $22\%$.How much does it cost now?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    $ \begin{aligned} &= 22 \% \times 500 \\ &= \dfrac {22} {100} \times 500 \\ &= \dfrac {22 \times 500} {100} \\ &= \dfrac {11000} {100} \\ &= \dfrac {110 \cancel {00}} {1 \cancel{00}} \\ &= 110 \\ &= 500 + 110 \\ &= 610 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    $610$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    oundle-school--11-plus--maths--2018--sample-paper-8.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    rag_ks_g1

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • ECC9C62A-5E83-4FDE-ACA1-1F96AF5CB532

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • The length of race track A is $3420.4 \ \text{metres}$.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The length of race track B is $74539.7 \ \text{metres}$.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        If a car travelled once around each race track, how far would it have travelled, in metres?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        $ \begin{array}{cccc} & 3 & 4 & 2 & 0 \ . 4 \\ {}+ & 7 & 4 & 5 & 3 & 9 \ . 7 \\
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        \hline & 7 & 7 & 9 & 6 & 0 \ . 1 \\

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        \end{array} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        $77960.1$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • A lorry can carry $68$ boxes, and each box contains $22$ books.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          How many books can the lorry carry?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          $ \begin{aligned} $ \begin{array}{cccc} & & & 6 & 8 \ \times & & & 2 & 2 \ \hline & 1 & 4 & 9 & 6 \end{array} $ \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          $1496$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • $2341 \ \text{litres}$ of water need to be carried in containers that are $21 \ \text{litres}$.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Interest is earned at a rate of $13\%$ per year.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              How much interest is earned on a starting balance of $\pounds 3058$, deposited for one year?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Subtract three sevenths from five sixths.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                $ \begin{aligned} &= \dfrac{5}{6} - \dfrac{3}{7} \\ &= \dfrac{5 \times 7}{6 \times 7} - \dfrac{3 \times 6}{7 \times 6} \\\ &= \dfrac{35}{42} - \dfrac{18}{42} \\ &= \dfrac{35 - 18}{42} \\ &= \dfrac{17}{42} \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                $\dfrac{17}{42}$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              oundle-school--11-plus--maths--2018--sample-paper-9.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              rag_ks_amber

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • 2789A11E-A02B-4F5F-8CBE-35BF532941D3

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tfraction
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Find four ninths of $963\text{p}$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $ \begin{aligned} &= \dfrac {4} {9} \ \text{ of } \ 963 \text{p} \\ &= \dfrac {4} {9} \times 963 \text{p} \\ &= \dfrac {4 \times 963} {9} \\ &= \dfrac {4 \times 107 \times 9} {9} \\ &= \dfrac {4 \times 107 \times \cancel{9}} {\cancel{9}} \\ &= 4 \times 107 \\ &= 428 \text {p} \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $428 \text {p}$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              reigate-grammar-school--11-plus--maths--2010--sample-paper-1.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              rag_sc_g1

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • 2B5D56B6-9D9F-41E6-8D6E-2058BC838997

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tfraction
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Find five eighths of $408 \text{p}$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $ \begin{aligned} &= \dfrac {5} {8} \ \text{of} \ 408 \text{p} \\ &= \dfrac {5} {8} \times 408 \text{p} \\ &= \dfrac {5 \times 408} {8} \\ &= \dfrac {5 \times 8 \times 51} {8} \\ &= \dfrac {5 \times \cancel{8} \times 51} {\cancel{8}} \\ &= 5 \times 51 \\ &= 255 \text{p} \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $255 \text{p}$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              reigate-grammar-school--11-plus--maths--2011--sample-paper-2.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              rag_sc_g1

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • A44E4F3A-9D7D-4F20-A66B-292B5CDE97B1

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Sam has $\pounds 3.85$ to spend. He buys a pencil for $38 \text{p}$ and a ruler for $59 \text{p}$. How much does he have left?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              rag_up_notstarted

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • A1C5A3A8-776A-4AE7-A826-842521976016

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tpercentage
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              %empty%

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              %empty%

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              %empty%

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • What is $10\%$ of $\pounds 250$?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  $ \begin{aligned} &= 10\% \ \text{of} \ \pounds 250 \\ &= 10\% \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {10} {100} \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {10 \times 250} {100} \\ &= \dfrac {1 \cancel{0} \times 25 \cancel{0}} {1 \cancel{0} \cancel{0}} \\ &= \pounds 25 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  $\pounds 25$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • What is $5\%$ of $\pounds 250$?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    $ \begin{aligned} &= 5\% \ \text{of} \ \pounds 250 \\ &= 5\% \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {5 \times 2} {1 \times 2} \% \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {10\%} {2} \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {10\% \text{of} 250} {2} \\ &= \dfrac {25} {2} \\ &= \pounds 12.5 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    $\pounds 12.5$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • What is $2 1/2\%$ of $\pounds 250$?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      $ \begin{aligned} &= 2 \dfrac {1} {2}\% \ \text{of} \ \pounds 250 \\ &= 2 \dfrac {1} {2}\% \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {5} {2}\% \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {5\% \ \text{of} \ 250} {2} \\ &= \dfrac {12.5} {2} \\ &= \dfrac {125} {20} \\ &= \dfrac {25 \times 5} {4 \times 5} \\ &= \dfrac {25 \times \cancel{5}} {4 \times \cancel{5}} \\ &= \dfrac {25} {4} \\ &= \pounds 6.25 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      $\pounds 6.25$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Use your answers to find $17\,1\diagup2\%$ of $\pounds 250$?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        $ \begin{aligned} &= 17 \dfrac {1} {2}\% \ \text{of} \ \pounds \ 250 \\ &= 17 \dfrac {1} {2}\% \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {35} {2}\% \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {(10 + 10 + 10 + 5)} {2}\% \times 250 \\ &= \dfrac {(10 + 10 + 10 + 5)} {2} \times 250 \\

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        &= \pounds \ 43.75 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        $\pounds \ 43.75$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      reigate-grammar-school--11-plus--maths--2013--sample-paper-4.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      rag_sc_pr

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • B474E464-5AEF-419A-9B3D-08581A43D0DE

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Julie owed Tasweer $\pounds 12.70$. She paid her back with a $\pounds 20$ note but she did not have any change. How much does Tasweer now owe Julie?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          What is $20\%$ of $30\%$ of $40\%$ of $\pounds 50$?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          TODOWORKING

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          TODOWORKING

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          TODOANSWER

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          TODOANSWER

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          reigate-grammar-school--11-plus--maths--2018--sample-paper-5.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          rag_up_notstarted

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • 56C543D5-BB5B-4474-8B73-44CAEEF83470

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          A family with $\text{two}$ adults and $\text{three}$ children go to the Zoo. If an adult ticket costs $\pounds 9.50$ and a child ticket costs $\pounds 2.60$, how much change will they get if they pay with a $\pounds 50$ note?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          TODOWORKING

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          TODOWORKING

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          TODOANSWER

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          TODOANSWER

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          reigate-grammar-school--11-plus--maths--2019--sample-paper-6.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          rag_up_notstarted

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • 63A0B53E-C684-46F3-9F2D-D318FB75DE93

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • tpercentage
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          %empty%

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          %empty%

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          %empty%

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • What is $10\%$ of $\pounds 760$?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $ \begin{aligned} &= 10\% \ \text{of} \ \pounds 760 \\ &= 10\% \times 760 \\ &= \dfrac {10} {100} \times 760 \\ &= \dfrac {10 \times 760} {100} \\ &= \dfrac {1 \cancel{0} \times 76 \cancel{0}} {1 \cancel{0} \cancel{0}} \\ &= \pounds 76 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $\pounds 76$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • What is $15\%$ of $\pounds 760$?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                As per the above question,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                $ \begin{aligned} &= 15\% \ \text{of} \ \pounds 760 \\ &= 15\% \times 760 \\ &= \dfrac {15\% \times 2} {1 \times 2} \times 760 \\ &= \dfrac {30\% \times 760} {2} \\ &= \dfrac {3 \times 10\% \times 760} {2} \\ &= \dfrac {3 \times 76} {2} \\ &= \dfrac {3 \times 2 \times 38} {2} \\ &= \dfrac {3 \times \cancel{2} \times 38} {\cancel{2}} \\ &= 3 \times 38 \\ &= \pounds 114 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                $\pounds 114$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              reigate-grammar-school--11-plus--maths--2019--sample-paper-6.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              rag_sc_g1

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • EFD43A9D-C622-4E56-8393-2CA2B39FA64E

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Tina owed Josh $\pounds 23.80$. She paid him back with three $\pounds 10$ notes but he did not have any change. How much does Josh now owe Tina?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              TODOWORKING

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Karen and Fran have some money. Karen has $\pounds 9$ more than Fran, together they have $\pounds 45$. How much money does Karen have?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              TODOWORKING

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • E939A9F2-9AF4-43F6-9C5F-9F1C96A47959

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tmoney
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tfraction
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tpercentage

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              What is $\dfrac{1}{4}$ of $20\%$ of $\dfrac{1}{6}$ of $40\%$ of $\pounds 1200$?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $ \begin{aligned} &= \dfrac {1} {4} \ \text{of} \ 20\% \ \text{of} \ \dfrac {1} {6} \ \text{of} \ 40\% \ \text{of} \ \pounds 1200 \\ &= \dfrac {1} {4} \times 20\% \times \dfrac {1} {6} \times 40\% \times 1200 \\ &= \dfrac {1} {4} \times \dfrac {20} {100} \times \dfrac {1} {6} \times \dfrac {40} {100} \times \dfrac {1200} {1} \\ &= \dfrac {1\times 20 \times 1 \times 40 \times 1200} {4 \times 100 \times 6 \times 100} \\ &= \dfrac {2 \cancel {0} \times 4\cancel {0} \times 12 \cancel {00}} {4 \times 1\cancel {00} \times 6 \times 1\cancel {00}} \\ &= \dfrac {2 \times 4 \times 12} {4 \times 6} \\ &= \dfrac {2 \times 4 \times 2 \times 6} {4 \times 6} \\ &= \dfrac {4 \times \cancel {4} \times \cancel {6}} { \cancel {4} \times \cancel {6}} \\ &= \pounds 4 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $\pounds 4$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              reigate-grammar-school--11-plus--maths--2019--sample-paper-6.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              rag_sc_pr

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • 29A6018D-4F9B-47BC-AEF7-2AB556029423

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              If an adult ticket on the bus costs $\pounds 1.50$ and a child ticket costs $90 \text{p}$, how much change will a family of $2$ adults and their $3$ children get if they pay with a $\pounds 10$ note?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • What is $\dfrac{1}{4}$ of ${68}$ ?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        $ \begin{aligned} &= \dfrac {1} {4} \ \text{of} \ 68 \\ &= \dfrac {1} {4} \times 68 \\ &= \dfrac {1 \times 17 \times 4} {4} \\ &= \dfrac {17 \times \cancel{4}} {\cancel{4}} \\ &= 17 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        $17$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Emma pays a deposit of $\pounds70.00$ and then pays instalments of $\pounds10$ per month over the course of one year (12 months).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Who pays the most and by how much ? How many adults & children were in the party? There was at least one adult.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Show all of your working clearly.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • tmoney

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Mr Green is organising a school trip. In Year 5 there are $53$ pupils and in Year 6 there are $46$ pupils. There will also be $28$ adults.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Mr Green has two options:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Help Mr Green find the best deal.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Each child will have a party bag to take home with a lollipop and a toy.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Empty party bags are sold in packs of $12$ and cost $\pounds2$ per pack.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Lollipops are sold in packs of $8$ and cost $\pounds4$ per pack.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Toys are sold in packs of $9$ and cost $\pounds10$ per pack.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        As a special new year offer, all prices are reduced by one quarter.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        How many packs of each item will she need to buy and what will be her total cost? Show all your working clearly.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Maya made three purchases for $\pounds 1.08, \pounds 5.04$ and $\pounds 9.89$. What did she spend in total, to the nearest pound?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        $ \begin{aligned} \text{Amount spent} &= 1.08 + 5.04 + 9.89 \\ &= \pounds 16.01 \end{aligned} $

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        $\pounds 16.01$

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        sevenoaks-school--11-plus--maths--2011--sample-paper-2.toml

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        rag_np_pr

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • FEDF1274-F3D1-48A8-9364-946A301048E2
